text:
The following code gets a file list to delete with resourcelist. Files from file list will be deleted, but directories containing anything won't. Empty directories in file list will be deleted.

<delete includeemptydirs="true" defaultexcludes="false">
  <resourcelist>				
    <file file="${delete.file}" />
  </resourcelist>
</delete>

Ant should behave like passing the directory by dir-attribute and delete recursively.
creator: andreas.daab@getit.de

text:
from <delete>'s manual

> no attempt will be made to delete non-empty directories in any case

and a bit later it talks about the one case that is different from historic reasons.

So not deleting the non-empty dirs is not a bug but rather the intended behavior.
creator: bodewig@apache.org
